column1: In Narsingh Das v. Mangal Dubey6, Mr. Justice Mahmood, the celebrated Judge of the
"Courts are not to act upon the principle that every procedure is to be taken as
prohibited unless it is expressly provided for by the Code, but on the converse
principle that every procedure is to be understood as permissible till it is shown
to be prohibited by the law. As a matter of general principle prohibition cannot
